name: rambunctiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is full of energy and difficult to control: On a rainy afternoon, the children bounce rambunctiously around the living room. The little black dog no longer moved as quickly or as rambunctiously as she had as a puppy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe cast capture the vitality in the music of one of this country's most rambunctiously creative composers.In his latest film, he portrays a rambunctiously rebellious character.The novel is described as good-hearted and rambunctiously witty.
